oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The use of lidocaine-loaded castration bands to castrate beef-dairy calves and its effect on animal welfare and performance
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Mancke, Madeline
Bortoluzzi, Eduardo M.
White, Brad
Bigelow, Rebecca
Schumacher, Jake
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Castration is a common management method among livestock producers and animal welfare concerns exist following castra­tion. The study’s aim was to compare behavior, performance and health measures between calves castrated with a lidocaine-loaded castration band (Lidoband™) to a standard band with no pain relief.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; Vol. 58 No. 58 (2024): 2024 AABP Annual Conference Proceedings; 200
